intro: Licania cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and palmately lobed leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Licania cuatrecasasii is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
